description: dpkg-divert - override a package's version of a file

global_flags.description: the  administrative  directory  to  directory.   Defaults  to «/var/lib/dpkg» if DPKG_ADMINDIR has not been set.
as  provided by other packages, will be diverted.
Defaults  to  «/»  if DPKG_ROOT has not been set.
show what package diverts the file.

that  all  packages' versions of this file are diverted. This means, that there are no exceptions, and whatever  package  is installed,  the  file is diverted.  This can be used by an admin to install a locally modified version.

that  the  file  should  not  be renamed while adding or removing the diversion into the database (since dpkg 1.19.1).  This is intended for diversions of files from the Essential package set, where the temporary disappearance  of  the  original  file  is  not acceptable,  as  it  can render the system non-functional.  This is the default behavior, but that  will  change  in  the  dpkg  1.20.x cycle.
file  will  not  be diverted.   i.e.  file  will  be  diverted  for all packages except package.

back).   dpkg-divert  will  abort operation in case the destination file already exists.  This is the common behavior used for diversions of files from the non-Essential package set (see --no-rename for more details).

the  root  directory to directory, which sets the installation directory  to  «directory»  and  the  administrative  directory  to «directory/var/lib/dpkg»  (since  dpkg 1.19.2) if DPKG_ROOT has not been set.
mode,   i.e.   don't  actually  perform  any  changes,  just demonstrate.
